I recently came across a review of the Google Data Analytics course, where the reviewer gave it a 3/10 rating. While I understand their point that the course only covers the basics and doesn't dive deep into topics like SQL, Tableau, and R, I have to respectfully disagree.As someone who's passionate about lifelong learning, I believe that a wise student shouldn't just stop at the course material. Instead, we should use it as a starting point and do our own research to dive deeper into the topics.My culture of learning has always been to go beyond the surface level and seek out the underlying principles. I encourage all students, whether you're taking the Google Data Analytics course or any other, to adopt this mindset.Don't just take things at face value - dig deeper, ask questions, and keep improving your skills. The moment you stop learning is the moment you stop growing.Let's keep pushing ourselves to be better and stay curious! hashtag#lifelonglearning hashtag#datanalytics hashtag#googledataanalytics hashtag#learningmindset hashtag#MathsTutor

I recently came across a review of the Google Data Analytics course, where the reviewer gave it a 3/10 rating. While I understand their point that the course only covers the basics and doesn't dive deep into topics like SQL, Tableau, and R, I have to respectfully disagree.As someone who's passionate about lifelong learning, I believe that a wise student shouldn't just stop at the course material. Instead, we should use it as a starting point and do our own research to dive deeper into the topics.My culture of learning has always been to go beyond the surface level and seek out the underlying principles. I encourage all students, whether you're taking the Google Data Analytics course or any other, to adopt this mindset.Don't just take things at face value - dig deeper, ask questions, and keep improving your skills. The moment you stop learning is the moment you stop growing.Let's keep pushing ourselves to be better and stay curious! hashtag#lifelonglearning hashtag#datanalytics hashtag#googledataanalytics hashtag#learningmindset hashtag#MathsTutor

I recently came across a review of the Google Data Analytics course, where the reviewer gave it a 3/10 rating. While I understand their point that the course only covers the basics and doesn't dive deep into topics like SQL, Tableau, and R, I have to respectfully disagree.As someone who's passionate about lifelong learning, I believe that a wise student shouldn't just stop at the course material. Instead, we should use it as a starting point and do our own research to dive deeper into the topics.My culture of learning has always been to go beyond the surface level and seek out the underlying principles. I encourage all students, whether you're taking the Google Data Analytics course or any other, to adopt this mindset.Don't just take things at face value - dig deeper, ask questions, and keep improving your skills. The moment you stop learning is the moment you stop growing.Let's keep pushing ourselves to be better and stay curious! hashtag#lifelonglearning hashtag#datanalytics hashtag#googledataanalytics hashtag#learningmindset hashtag#MathsTutor

I recently came across a review of the Google Data Analytics course, where the reviewer gave it a 3/10 rating. While I understand their point that the course only covers the basics and doesn't dive deep into topics like SQL, Tableau, and R, I have to respectfully disagree.As someone who's passionate about lifelong learning, I believe that a wise student shouldn't just stop at the course material. Instead, we should use it as a starting point and do our own research to dive deeper into the topics.My culture of learning has always been to go beyond the surface level and seek out the underlying principles. I encourage all students, whether you're taking the Google Data Analytics course or any other, to adopt this mindset.Don't just take things at face value - dig deeper, ask questions, and keep improving your skills. The moment you stop learning is the moment you stop growing.Let's keep pushing ourselves to be better and stay curious! hashtag#lifelonglearning hashtag#datanalytics hashtag#googledataanalytics hashtag#learningmindset hashtag#MathsTutor

I recently came across a review of the Google Data Analytics course, where the reviewer gave it a 3/10 rating. While I understand their point that the course only covers the basics and doesn't dive deep into topics like SQL, Tableau, and R, I have to respectfully disagree.As someone who's passionate about lifelong learning, I believe that a wise student shouldn't just stop at the course material. Instead, we should use it as a starting point and do our own research to dive deeper into the topics.My culture of learning has always been to go beyond the surface level and seek out the underlying principles. I encourage all students, whether you're taking the Google Data Analytics course or any other, to adopt this mindset.Don't just take things at face value - dig deeper, ask questions, and keep improving your skills. The moment you stop learning is the moment you stop growing.Let's keep pushing ourselves to be better and stay curious! hashtag#lifelonglearning hashtag#datanalytics hashtag#googledataanalytics hashtag#learningmindset hashtag#MathsTutor

I recently came across a review of the Google Data Analytics course, where the reviewer gave it a 3/10 rating. While I understand their point that the course only covers the basics and doesn't dive deep into topics like SQL, Tableau, and R, I have to respectfully disagree.As someone who's passionate about lifelong learning, I believe that a wise student shouldn't just stop at the course material. Instead, we should use it as a starting point and do our own research to dive deeper into the topics.My culture of learning has always been to go beyond the surface level and seek out the underlying principles. I encourage all students, whether you're taking the Google Data Analytics course or any other, to adopt this mindset.Don't just take things at face value - dig deeper, ask questions, and keep improving your skills. The moment you stop learning is the moment you stop growing.Let's keep pushing ourselves to be better and stay curious! hashtag#lifelonglearning hashtag#datanalytics hashtag#googledataanalytics hashtag#learningmindset hashtag#MathsTutor

I recently came across a review of the Google Data Analytics course, where the reviewer gave it a 3/10 rating. While I understand their point that the course only covers the basics and doesn't dive deep into topics like SQL, Tableau, and R, I have to respectfully disagree.As someone who's passionate about lifelong learning, I believe that a wise student shouldn't just stop at the course material. Instead, we should use it as a starting point and do our own research to dive deeper into the topics.My culture of learning has always been to go beyond the surface level and seek out the underlying principles. I encourage all students, whether you're taking the Google Data Analytics course or any other, to adopt this mindset.Don't just take things at face value - dig deeper, ask questions, and keep improving your skills. The moment you stop learning is the moment you stop growing.Let's keep pushing ourselves to be better and stay curious! hashtag#lifelonglearning hashtag#datanalytics hashtag#googledataanalytics hashtag#learningmindset hashtag#MathsTutor

I recently came across a review of the Google Data Analytics course, where the reviewer gave it a 3/10 rating. While I understand their point that the course only covers the basics and doesn't dive deep into topics like SQL, Tableau, and R, I have to respectfully disagree.As someone who's passionate about lifelong learning, I believe that a wise student shouldn't just stop at the course material. Instead, we should use it as a starting point and do our own research to dive deeper into the topics.My culture of learning has always been to go beyond the surface level and seek out the underlying principles. I encourage all students, whether you're taking the Google Data Analytics course or any other, to adopt this mindset.Don't just take things at face value - dig deeper, ask questions, and keep improving your skills. The moment you stop learning is the moment you stop growing.Let's keep pushing ourselves to be better and stay curious! hashtag#lifelonglearning hashtag#datanalytics hashtag#googledataanalytics hashtag#learningmindset hashtag#MathsTutor

Username: Edy Carolina Arroyo, MBA ğŸ‹Edy Carolina Arroyo, MBA ğŸ‹
Post Content:
You think you know your ideal customer.But if you're like 66% of new brands, you're guessing it.(and itâ€™s killing your GTM strategy)The problem?Many brands focus on surface-level traits.Job title, company size, and industry donâ€™t tell the whole story.Demographics show ğ˜„ğ—µğ—¼ your customer is.But behavioral data reveals ğ—µğ—¼ğ˜„ and ğ˜„ğ—µğ˜† they buy.Without these insights, you waste time chasing the wrong leads.Ones who look good on paper but have zero intention of signingyour DocuSign.You need a clear picture of your ideal customer profile (ICP).Hereâ€™s a simple 5-step framework to help you define your ICP ğŸ‘‡1. Start with rejection:Who should NEVER buy from you?â†’ Identify red flags: wrong budget, wrong mindset, wrong use case.â†³ Example: If you offer premium services, anyone seeking a â€œcheap fixâ€ is not your customer.2. Study your "wrong" customers:Look at clients who left or churned.â†’ Read cancellation reasons, refund requests, and negative reviews.â†³ Example: If clients churned because your software was â€œtoo complex,â€ your ICP might need teams with the expertise to handle robust solutions.3. Find the unexpected patterns:Forget job titlesâ€”track behavioral triggers instead.â†’ What event pushed them to buy? A new boss? Missed revenue targets?â†³ Example: A training company found their best customers were CEOs needing quick fixes after firing their sales head. So they targeted companies hiring new sales leaders.4. Track the lurkers:Your best leads may not engage, but they watch closely.â†’ Monitor LinkedIn profile views, newsletter subscribers, and repeat website visitors.â†³ Example: If someone visits your pricing page multiple times without booking a call, they might be a high-intent leadâ€”reach out. Tools like PhantomBuster, LinkedIn Navigator, and Clearbit help.5. Flip your funnel:Start with your happiest customers and reverse-engineer their journey.â†’ What were they struggling with 6 months before finding you?â†³ Example: A marketing agency discovered their best clients were DIY-ing their content before hiring them. So they targeted business owners searching for content templates.New brands start at the top of the funnel.Smart ones start at the bottom and work up.Define your ICP clearly to drive growth.This is how you build a successful strategy.Follow me for EC Peasy tips ğŸ‹hashtag#GTM hashtag#marketstrategy hashtag#revenue

I recently came across a review of the Google Data Analytics course, where the reviewer gave it a 3/10 rating. While I understand their point that the course only covers the basics and doesn't dive deep into topics like SQL, Tableau, and R, I have to respectfully disagree.As someone who's passionate about lifelong learning, I believe that a wise student shouldn't just stop at the course material. Instead, we should use it as a starting point and do our own research to dive deeper into the topics.My culture of learning has always been to go beyond the surface level and seek out the underlying principles. I encourage all students, whether you're taking the Google Data Analytics course or any other, to adopt this mindset.Don't just take things at face value - dig deeper, ask questions, and keep improving your skills. The moment you stop learning is the moment you stop growing.Let's keep pushing ourselves to be better and stay curious! hashtag#lifelonglearning hashtag#datanalytics hashtag#googledataanalytics hashtag#learningmindset hashtag#MathsTutor

Username: Edy Carolina Arroyo, MBA ğŸ‹Edy Carolina Arroyo, MBA ğŸ‹
Post Content:
You think you know your ideal customer.But if you're like 66% of new brands, you're guessing it.(and itâ€™s killing your GTM strategy)The problem?Many brands focus on surface-level traits.Job title, company size, and industry donâ€™t tell the whole story.Demographics show ğ˜„ğ—µğ—¼ your customer is.But behavioral data reveals ğ—µğ—¼ğ˜„ and ğ˜„ğ—µğ˜† they buy.Without these insights, you waste time chasing the wrong leads.Ones who look good on paper but have zero intention of signingyour DocuSign.You need a clear picture of your ideal customer profile (ICP).Hereâ€™s a simple 5-step framework to help you define your ICP ğŸ‘‡1. Start with rejection:Who should NEVER buy from you?â†’ Identify red flags: wrong budget, wrong mindset, wrong use case.â†³ Example: If you offer premium services, anyone seeking a â€œcheap fixâ€ is not your customer.2. Study your "wrong" customers:Look at clients who left or churned.â†’ Read cancellation reasons, refund requests, and negative reviews.â†³ Example: If clients churned because your software was â€œtoo complex,â€ your ICP might need teams with the expertise to handle robust solutions.3. Find the unexpected patterns:Forget job titlesâ€”track behavioral triggers instead.â†’ What event pushed them to buy? A new boss? Missed revenue targets?â†³ Example: A training company found their best customers were CEOs needing quick fixes after firing their sales head. So they targeted companies hiring new sales leaders.4. Track the lurkers:Your best leads may not engage, but they watch closely.â†’ Monitor LinkedIn profile views, newsletter subscribers, and repeat website visitors.â†³ Example: If someone visits your pricing page multiple times without booking a call, they might be a high-intent leadâ€”reach out. Tools like PhantomBuster, LinkedIn Navigator, and Clearbit help.5. Flip your funnel:Start with your happiest customers and reverse-engineer their journey.â†’ What were they struggling with 6 months before finding you?â†³ Example: A marketing agency discovered their best clients were DIY-ing their content before hiring them. So they targeted business owners searching for content templates.New brands start at the top of the funnel.Smart ones start at the bottom and work up.Define your ICP clearly to drive growth.This is how you build a successful strategy.Follow me for EC Peasy tips ğŸ‹hashtag#GTM hashtag#marketstrategy hashtag#revenue
